results.title: Cancer in women
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Wright, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A self-help film designed to convince women of the need for regular physical check-ups to detect and counter early symptoms of cancer. The cost of neglect is high, and the film presents ample and convincing evidence: what is shown is strong medicine, and intentionally so— the malignant growths, the ugly scars, the excised tumours. The procedures followed in examination for cancer are shown.

results.title: Canada wild
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Grainger Maynard and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: This adventure records the superb wildlife and wilderness of outback Canada, beginning in the stunning Queen Charlotte Islands, the Galapagos of North America. We sail past foraging bears, whales, raccoons, seals and sea lions, catching Coho Salmon in the land Haida Indians. The action then moves to the Rocky Mountains with a spectacular horse trek and white water rafting in the famous raging rapids. We then travel to Baffin Island in the Arctic Circle to hunt caribou and seal with the Inuit Indians - the Canadian Eskimos. It is a wonderful journey through the beautiful and remote Canadian wilderness.

results.title: Canada vignettes: Log driver's waltz
results.creator_credit: John Weldon, David Verrall, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A young girl who loves to dance and is ready to marry chooses a log driver over his more well-to-do, land-loving competition. Driving logs down the river has made him the best dancing partner to be found. This lighthearted, animated tale is based on the song The Log Driver’s Waltz by Wade Hemsworth. Kate and Anna McGarrigle sing to the music of the Mountain City Four.

results.title: Canada in world war one
results.creator_credit: Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Suitable for classroom use, this film shows World War 1 in the context of world developments before and since. It presents a vivid and authentic record of events from 1914 to 1918, in Canada and Europe. In this film, young Canadians see what they are asked to “remember” on November 11th. Written by Strowan Robertson and edited by David Green.

results.title: Canada calling
results.creator_credit: David A. Smith, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An outline of Canadian radio activity. Commentator John Fisher briefly reviews the history of radio in this country and of the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation’s present three-network set-up. The variety of radio fare for Canadians is indicated by snatches of favorite programs; Trio Lyrique; Mart Kenney; the Toronto Symphony; the Happy Gang; forums; religious programs; drama; and old-time music. The variety of people involved in the business of broadcasting is described, and concluding sequences deal with the CBC International Service.

results.title: Canada: fibres, yarns and fabrics
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, Julian Biggs, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shot at Bruck Mills Limited and Dominion Textiles Limited in Montreal, this film shows the rigid tests and quality controls that go into the manufacture of fine Canadian fabrics.

results.title: Canada's National Library
results.creator_credit: John Ralph, Barrie Howells, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film offers a cinematic tour of Canada’s National Library. It shows that this huge structure in the centre of Ottawa is more than a repository for books. The history of Canada is housed here, preserved in old letters, newspapers, books, music scores and manuscripts. This film provides an interesting overview of the services offered by the library, highlighting the fully automated reference service, which can respond in minutes to the steady flow of inquiries the Library receives from the public. Voice and narration is provided by Bronwyn Drainie.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Ralph, Barrie Howells, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Can You Hear Me?
results.creator_credit: John Fitzgerald, Impact Films and New South Wales. Coal Board
results.brief_description: How to protect our amazingly sensitive hearing from the hazard of noise at the workplace. Animation and live action reveal detail of the inner ear where excessive noise can cause permanent deafness. A guideline allows workers to assess dangerous noise levels where ear protection must be worn. Shows adverse social consequences of noise deafness, with straight answers from a doctor.

results.title: Canada's reindeer
results.creator_credit: Inuk Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In 1935 a herd of 2,700 reindeer completed a five-year journey from Alaska to north of the Arctic circle. They were imported and re-settled by the Canadian Government in an effort to improve the economic conditions of the Inuit. This film is the story of the trek, the raising of reindeer for saleable meat, its effects upon the people and the transformation of herding from a primitive art to one using modern technology. The film shows how an ecologically sound, make-work project that started as a gamble ended up a success, generating jobs and money for the local people.

results.title: Call of the home village = Xiang qing [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Bingliu Hu, Jin Wang and Pearl River Film Studio
results.brief_description: One of the first Chinese films to be selected to participate in the Berlin International Film Festival, ‘Xiang Qing’ set a new standard in Chinese film realism. Made on location in Guangong Province, the film tells the story of a young man who has been brought up in the country by a foster mother. On registering to marry his childhood sweetheart, a foster child from the same family, he suddenly discovers his true identity and is reunited with his real parents, high ranking city officials from whom he was separated at birth. The film deals with the discrepancies between rural and city life, and the conflicting loyalties the young man feels towards his two families. Cast: Xiaolei Huang, Yexiang Ren, Wenghua Wu, Zhong Deng. In Mandarin with English subtitles.
